parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the heater core can cause excessive steam to emit through the vents, reducing visibility and potentially leading to accidents. It can also cause burns to the driver's foot or leg due to hot coolant leaking into the vehicle.
symptoms: Excessive steam emitting through the vents
hot coolant leaking into the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the engine cooling system can cause the engine to overheat, leading to damage to the engine and potentially causing accidents.
The failure of the radiator fan motor can cause the engine to overheat, leading to damage to the engine and potentially causing accidents.
symptoms: Radiator fan motor is worn and noisy

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the exhaust system can cause loud exhaust noise, which can be a nuisance to the driver and other road users.
Heater core failure can cause sudden loss of visibility due to steam on the windshield, leading to accidents or loss of control of the vehicle.
symptoms: hot coolant pouring on the driver's leg and foot
and loss of control of the car.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Inadequate windshield wiper performance can reduce visibility, leading to accidents or loss of control of the vehicle.
symptoms: The driver's wiper doesn't wipe 2/3rds of the windshield
requiring tampering with the wiper arm to make it work correctly.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A malfunctioning sunroof can cause inconvenience and potentially lead to safety issues if it obstructs the driver's view.
symptoms: The factory-installed sunroof would not retract.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the motorized seat belt can leave passengers unprotected in the event of an accident, increasing the risk of injury or fatality.
symptoms: The seat belt gets stuck in the out position
will not retract back into position
the shoulder belt does not work due to a shortage in the motorized system
the lap/shoulder belt will not retract on the passenger's and driver's sides
the tab on which the motorized seat belt system is latched broke off
electrical short circuit causing a fire with the automatic seatbelt.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electrical system can cause a fire under the hood, leading to a loss of vehicle control, and potentially resulting in accidents or injuries.
The failure of the ignition switch can cause the starter to malfunction, making it difficult or impossible to start the vehicle, which can lead to inconvenience and potential safety risks.
The failure of the motor belt retraction system can cause the belts to retract unexpectedly, leading to engine damage, loss of vehicle control, and potential safety risks.
symptoms: Motor belts retract when engine is switched off
belts retract when driving over a bump
belts retract when ignition switch is wiggled.
